abstract: Detroit’s automakers are getting some help from the federal government, at least in terms of their efforts to find flaws in the new pickup built by their Japanese rival Toyota Motor.
snippet: Detroit’s automakers are getting some help from the federal government, at least in terms of their efforts to find flaws in the new pickup built by their Japanese rival Toyota Motor.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT, March 19 — Detroit’s automakers are getting some help from the federal government, at least in terms of their efforts to find flaws in the new pickup built by their Japanese rival Toyota Motor.

headline.main: Toyota Pickup Scores Below-Perfect on Safety
headline.print_headline: Toyota Pickup Scores Below-Perfect on Safety
